Manifolds:

  • Real vector space: \(\mathbb{R}^n\)
  • Symmetric Matrices: \(\operatorname{Sym}(n)\)
  • Skew-symmetric Matrices: \(\operatorname{Skew}(n)\)
  • Sphere: \(\mathbb{S}^n\)
  • Special Orthogonal Group: \(\operatorname{SO}(n)\)
  • Stiefel Manifold: \(\operatorname{St}(n,k)\)
  • Grassmannian Manifold: \(\operatorname{Gr}(n,k)\)
  • Variety of Low Rank Matrices: \(\operatorname{LowRank}(n,k,r)\)

Constructions:

  • Product Manifold: \(M_1 \times \dots \times M_k\)

  • Variety of Low Rank Matrices: \(\operatorname{LowRank}(n,k,r)\)

Variety of Low Rank Matrices: \(\operatorname{LowRank}(n,k,r)\)¶

\(\operatorname{LowRank}(n,k,r)\) is the algebraic variety of matrices of rank less or equal to \(r\), with \(r \leq \min\{n, k\}\):

\[\operatorname{LowRank}(n,k,r) = \{X \in \mathbb{R}^{n\times k}\:\mid\:\operatorname{rank}(X) \leq r\}\]

It is realized via a SVD-like factorization. In particular, it is implemented via the projection

\[\begin{split}\begin{align*} \pi \colon \operatorname{St}(n,r) \times \mathbb{R}^r \times \operatorname{St}(k, r) &\to \operatorname{LowRank}(n,k,r) \\ (U, \Sigma, V) &\mapsto U\Sigma V^\intercal \end{align*}\end{split}\]

where we have identified \(\mathbb{R}^r\) with a diagonal matrix in \(\mathbb{R}^{r \times r}\).

class geotorch.lowrank.LowRank(size, rank)[source]¶

Variety of the matrices of rank \(r\) or less.

Parameters

  • size (torch.size) – Size of the tensor to be applied to

  • rank (int) – Rank of the matrices. It has to be less than \(\min\(\texttt{size}[-1], \texttt{size}[-2]\)\)
